intro: Gymnoleima oleifolium, commonly known as the oilleaf gum tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its leathery, lance-shaped leaves that have a distinctive oil-containing surface. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers, which are often visited by native bees and birds. Gymnoleima oleifolium is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
